marketNews.title: Penerimaan Anjlok, APBN Defisit pada 2M25
marketNews.content:
The Ministry of Finance held a briefing on the realization of the 2025 State Budget (APBN) on Thursday (13/3). This is the first APBN briefing in 2025, after the Ministry did not hold a discussion for January 2025 last month. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said the briefing on the realization of the APBN for January 2025 was not carried out to ensure comparable and accurate data presentation, considering several factors that occurred at the beginning of the year.

Key notes on the APBN realization for the first two months of 2025 (2M25):
- Revenue fell 20.8% year‑on‑year (YoY), equal to 10.5% of the target. Deputy Finance Minister Anggito Abimanyu said gross tax revenue during 2M25 slowed down (-20.8% YoY) due to lower commodity prices, including coal (-11.8% YoY), Brent oil (-5.2% YoY) and nickel (-5.9% YoY). The decline in tax revenue also resulted from tax administration factors, such as the implementation of the Effective Average Rate (TER) policy for personal income tax (PPh 21) and the relaxation of domestic VAT payment until the 10th day (until 10 March 2025) for tax reporting.
- Expenditure fell 7% YoY, equal to 9.6% of the target. Deputy Finance Minister Suahasil Nazara said state spending dropped -7% YoY during 2M25 because of a high‑base effect from high expenditures at the end of 2023 to early 2024 due to El Niño. He also explained that President Prabowo Subianto's instruction on ministry/agency spending efficiency up to IDR 306.7 trillion aims to fund priority government programs, add fiscal space for productive spending, and finance the new regional head vision‑mission programs.
- Deficit appeared earlier, reaching 0.13% of GDP. With this progress, the APBN recorded a deficit of IDR 31.2 trillion or 0.13% of GDP during 2M25, marking an earlier deficit compared to the previous year (vs. February 2024: surplus 0.11% of GDP). This is the first time the APBN posted a deficit in the first two months of the fiscal year since 2021, according to Bloomberg.
- Budget financing reached 35.7% of the target. Sri Mulyani also noted a large issuance at the beginning of the year, so budget financing reached IDR 220.1 trillion (vs. the 2025 APBN target of IDR 616.2 trillion). Nevertheless, this progress is similar to the February 2024 realization, which reached 35.4% of the 2024 APBN target.

When closing the press conference, Sri Mulyani opened the possibility that the APBN realization briefing could be skipped in certain months due to internal data considerations.

In addition to the APBN issue, Bloomberg reported that there is a rumor President Prabowo is preparing a cabinet reshuffle, which may involve Sri Mulyani. The Presidential Communication Office spokesperson Phillips J. Vermonte declined to comment but emphasized that President Prabowo has the prerogative to conduct a reshuffle. Sri Mulyani herself declined to comment to several national media outlets on Wednesday (12/3).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The widening APBN deficit risk is a concern for investors, affecting the Indonesian rupiah, which has weakened by 2% year‑to‑date (YTD) to IDR 16,425 per US dollar, while the US Dollar Index (DXY) fell 4.4% YTD to 103.7. A weak rupiah narrows the space for Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates, even though expectations of Fed rate cuts have increased recently amid investor worries about a potential US recession due to trade wars. Bloomberg consensus projects that Bank Indonesia will cut rates by 50 basis points by the end of 2025.

marketNews.title: ISAT Rumored to Divest $1 Billion Fiber Asset
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that I Squared Capital and Macquarie are among potential buyers of Indosat's ($ISAT) fiber optic assets valued at US$1 billion. Sources said ISAT could sell up to 75% of its fiber business, with the final offer due in April 2025. However, no final decision has been made, and the share portion and timeline may change depending on market conditions. ISAT has not commented on the issue. The fiber divestment rumor has been present since at least 2023. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in September 2024 that Dayamitra Telekomunikasi ($MTEL), Protelindo, and XL Axiata ($EXCL) were interested in the asset.

marketNews.title: GoTo Targets Adjusted EBITDA 1.4‑1.6 Trillion Rupiah in 2025
marketNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia management targets adjusted EBITDA of approximately IDR 1.4‑1.6 trillion for 2025 (vs. 2024: IDR 386 billion). Within that amount, the On‑Demand Services (ODS) segment is projected to contribute at least IDR 1.1 trillion, while the Fintech segment is expected to contribute at least IDR 350 billion.

marketNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Increases Stake in Petrosea
marketNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada purchased approximately 8.3 million Petrosea shares at an average price of IDR 3,263 per share on 10‑11 March 2025. The total transaction value is about IDR 27 billion. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO rose from 42.394% to 42.476%.

marketNews.title: Bank Tabungan Negara to Acquire Bank Victoria Syariah
marketNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) CEO Nixon L.P. Napitupulu said the acquisition value of Bank Victoria Syariah is around IDR 1.5‑1.6 trillion. In the transaction, BBTN will take over the State Securities (SBN) and loan equity of PT Bank Victoria Syariah, but will not assume the bank's pre‑acquisition credit and third‑party funds (DPK). PT Bank Victoria Syariah is directly owned about 80.2% by Victoria Investama ($VICO) and 19.8% by Bank Victoria International ($BVIC). The acquisition is expected to be completed in May 2025, with the BBTN shareholders meeting scheduled for 14 March 2025.

marketNews.title: Sarana Mitra Insan Lestari Targets 100‑110 Billion Rupiah Net Profit in 2025
marketNews.content: Head of Investor Relations Ridwan Syah said SMIL targets net profit of about IDR 100‑110 billion in 2025, with revenue growth of +20‑25% YoY. For context, SMIL projects 2024 net profit in the range of IDR 80‑90 billion. The performance growth will be supported by regional market expansion and customer acquisition, including a cooperation agreement with one of Indonesia's largest tobacco companies. SMIL also plans to raise its dividend payout ratio for FY2024 from 20% to around 40%.

marketNews.title: Timah Targets 15% Tin Production Growth and Profit Turnaround in 2025
marketNews.content: Timah (TINS) Secretary Rendi Kurniawan said the company targets tin production to grow +15% YoY in 2025 to a range of 21,000‑23,000 tons. He also noted that TINS's 2024 net profit is estimated at IDR 1‑1.1 trillion, reversing a loss of IDR 450 billion in 2023, although the 2024 financial statements have not yet been audited. Previously, TINS targeted net profit of IDR 1‑1.5 trillion in 2025 and pledged to pay a dividend for FY2024 with a payout ratio of around 30‑35%.

marketNews.title: TBS Energi Utama Reports Net Loss of US$6.4 Million in Q4 2024
marketNews.content: TBS Energi Utama (TOBA) recorded a net loss of US$6.4 million in Q4 2024 (vs. Q3 2024 net profit of US$8.3 million, Q3 2023 net profit of US$410 thousand). This resulted in a 2024 net profit of US$28.5 million (+260% YoY). Although revenue grew +24% QoQ in Q4 2024, cost of goods sold surged +65% QoQ, causing gross margin to fall to 5.9% in Q4 2024 (vs. 28.3% in Q3 2024). The increase in cost of goods sold was driven by higher coal purchases and higher freight and crane costs, which rose +156% QoQ and +63% QoQ respectively.

marketNews.title: US Consumer Price Index Shows Cooling Inflation in February 2025
marketNews.content: The US Consumer Price Index (CPI) eased to 2.8% YoY in February 2025 (vs. 3.0% YoY in January 2025), below the consensus expectation of 2.9% YoY. On a monthly basis, CPI eased to 0.2% MoM (vs. 0.5% MoM in January 2025), lower than the consensus of 0.3% MoM. Core inflation slowed to 3.1% YoY and 0.2% MoM (vs. 3.3% YoY and 0.4% MoM in January 2025), both below consensus expectations of 3.2% YoY and 0.3% MoM, marking the lowest annual core inflation since April 2021.

marketNews.title: J.P. Morgan Economist Sees 40% Chance of US Recession in 2025
marketNews.content: J.P. Morgan Chief Economist Bruce Kasman said on Wednesday (13/3) there is about a 40% probability that the US economy will enter a recession in 2025, up from 30% earlier this year. He added that recession risk could rise to 50% or higher if the retaliatory tariff proposed by US President Donald Trump is implemented in April 2025. Kasman also warned of long‑term damage to the US's investment appeal if a Trump administration undermines confidence in US governance.

marketNews.title: Canada Announces 25% Counter‑Tariffs on US Imports
marketNews.content: Canada announced on Wednesday (12/3) a 25% counter‑tariff on US imports worth approximately US$20.7 billion, effective Thursday (13/3). The counter‑tariff targets steel and aluminium as well as other consumer goods such as electronic equipment, household appliances, and sports equipment. The measure follows the US's own 25% tariff on steel and aluminium announced on Wednesday (12/3).

marketNews.title: DHL CEO Projects Moderate Global Trade Growth Amid US Tariff Policies
marketNews.content: DHL Group CEO Tobias Meyer said on Wednesday (12/3) that global trade is expected to continue growing, albeit at a moderate pace, as the world reacts to US President Donald Trump's tariff policies. The outlook is based mainly on the fact that 75% of global trade does not involve the US. According to the DHL Trade Atlas 2025 report prepared by DHL and New York University, global trade is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 3.1% from 2024 to 2029, faster than the previous decade. The report forecasts that India, Vietnam, Indonesia, and the Philippines will lead trade growth in 2024‑2029.

marketNews.title: Indomobil Multi Jasa Plans Rights Issue Up to 3 Billion New Shares
marketNews.content: Indomobil Multi Jasa (IMJS) clarified to the IDX that the company expects to raise approximately IDR 500‑600 billion by issuing up to 3 billion new shares, as announced last week. This amount represents 32.5‑39% of IMJS's total market capitalization as of Thursday (13/3) at roughly IDR 1.5 trillion. Controlling shareholder Indomobil Sukses Internasional (IMAS) will exercise its full rights, and the maximum dilution effect is 25.74%. The proceeds will be used for capital injections into subsidiaries. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders meeting on 14 April 2025.

marketNews.title: Puradelta Lestari Sets 2025 Marketing Sales Target at IDR 1.81 Trillion
marketNews.content: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) targets marketing sales of IDR 1.81 trillion in 2025, unchanged from the 2024 target and 3.2% lower than the 2024 realized marketing sales of IDR 1.87 trillion. Director and Company Secretary Tondy Suwanto said the conservative target considers national economic growth and global geopolitical conditions. He also noted that at the beginning of 2025, there is still demand for industrial land of about 90 hectares, dominated by data center projects, alongside other sectors such as FMCG and chemicals.

marketNews.title: Techno9 Indonesia Share Purchase by Djoni
marketNews.content: Shareholder of Techno9 Indonesia (NINE), Djoni, bought approximately 10 million NINE shares at an average price of IDR 254 per share on 11 March 2025. The total transaction value is about IDR 2.5 billion. After the transaction, Djoni's ownership in NINE increased from 4.63% to 5.1%.

marketNews.title: Intiland Development Founder and CEO Hendro Santoso Gondokusumo Passes Away
marketNews.content: Founder and President Director of Intiland Development (DILD), Hendro Santoso Gondokusumo, died in Singapore today, Thursday (13/3).
